column4: Hey. I need some help guys. I am trying to install ipwraw-ng, by using "make". But I get the error when trying to make: "Error 1, and also Error 2". I have got the same problem trying to install or make other programs..
did you run configure yet?
I guess not..
have you ever built anything from source before?
there will typically be a couple files in the top of the source tree: INSTALL and README
they usually explain the build process, but, in general, it's usually something like:
./configure --prefix=/usr/local && make && make install ...dont't blindly run those commands, though
since ubuntu uses a package manager, though, you want to avoid mixing and matching prgs built from source with deb packages
i would probably install it in your home directory or in /usr/local if you must
that said, you'll want to make sure that you get everything configured correctly (man pages in /usr/local/share, etc)
its totally fine to build and install in /usr/local, but you don't want to install it in /usr or partially in /usr or /usr/local
i would advise you to install it in $HOME
that way if you want to remove it, you can just manually delete it
http://www.tldp.org/HOWTO/Software-Building-HOWTO.html is a good place to start with learning how linux software _ought_ to work
When trying to use config, i get this error: No 'cfg' found in /sys/bus/pci/drivers/ipwraw.
what command did you try to run?
you didn't read the README or INSTALL files, did you
config deals with openssl library configuration - configure is a script in the top of the source tree
./configure --help
that will show you all the configuration options that are available to you
what directory are you in?
you'll need to untar the source tarball, then cd into the top of the source tree, then run the configure script
